adaa.analytics.rules.operator

Class RuleGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.tools.AbstractObservable<com.rapidminer.operator.Operator>
      • com.rapidminer.operator.Operator
        • com.rapidminer.operator.learner.AbstractLearner
          • adaa.analytics.rules.operator.RuleGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OperatorI18N, com.rapidminer.gui.wizards.ConfigurationListener, com.rapidminer.gui.wizards.PreviewListener, com.rapidminer.operator.annotation.ResourceConsumer, com.rapidminer.operator.learner.CapabilityProvider, com.rapidminer.operator.learner.Learner, com.rapidminer.parameter.ParameterHandler, com.rapidminer.tools.LoggingHandler, com.rapidminer.tools.Observable<com.rapidminer.operator.Operator>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpertRuleGenerator

    public class RuleGenerator
extends com.rapidminer.operator.learner.AbstractLearner
implements OperatorI18N
    The basic RuleKit learner operator. It enables inducing classification, regression, and survival rules - the problem type is established automatically using metadata of the training set.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  RuleGenerator.MeasureDestination
      Auxiliary enumeration type describing possible destinations of quality measures.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ClassificationMetaCondition classificationMetaCondition
      Parameter condition fulfilled for classification problems.
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_IGNORE_MISSING
      Boolean telling whether missing values should be ignored (by default, a missing value of given attribute is always considered as not fulfilling the condition build upon that attribute)
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_INDUCTION_MEASURE
      Name of the rule quality measure used during growing (ignored in the survival analysis where log-rank statistics is used).
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_MAX_GROWING
      Non-negative integer representing maximum number of conditions which can be added to the rule in the growing phase (use this parameter for large datasets if execution time is prohibitive); 0 indicates no limit.
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_MAX_UNCOVERED_FRACTION
      Floating-point number from [0,1] interval representing maximum fraction of examples that may remain uncovered by the rule set.
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_MIN_RULE_COVERED
      Positive integer representing minimum number of previously uncovered examples to be covered by a new rule (positive examples for classification problems).
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_PRUNING_ENABLED
      Binary parameter indicating whether pruning should be enabled.
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_PRUNING_MEASURE
      Name of the rule quality measure used during pruning.
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_USER_INDUCTION_EQUATION
      Equation of user-defined induction measure; applies only when the corresponding measure parameter has value UserDefined; the equation must be a mathematical expression with p, n, P, N literals (elements of confusion matrix), operators, numbers, and library functions (sin, log, etc.).
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_USER_PRUNING_EQUATION
      Equation of user-defined pruning measure.
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_USER_VOTING_EQUATION
      Equation of user-defined voting measure.
      static java.lang.String PARAMETER_VOTING_MEASURE
      Name of the rule quality measure used during growing.
      protected com.rapidminer.operator.performance.PerformanceVector performances
      Performance vector for storing model characteristics.
      protected RegressionMetaCondition regressionMetaCondition
      Parameter condition fulfilled for regression problems.
      protected SurvivalMetaCondition survivalMetaCondition
      Parameter condition fulfilled for survival problems.

      • PARAMETER_USER_INDUCTION_EQUATION

        public static final java.lang.String PARAMETER_USER_INDUCTION_EQUATION
        Equation of user-defined induction measure; applies only when the corresponding measure parameter has value UserDefined; the equation must be a mathematical expression with p, n, P, N literals (elements of confusion matrix), operators, numbers, and library functions (sin, log, etc.).
